timeline.message: Provide initial implementation of views code for ES7.
Removing support for multiple query backends based on type.
Adding backwards-compatible constructor.
Adding events index mapping for ES7.
Fixing extraction of document count from initial search result.
Fixing extraction of document count from initial search result.

timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: Unused return value. Let's make this void to get rid of the warning.
timeline.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: Oops. Right. Sorry I overlooked that.
replies.author: alex-konn

timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: previousAggregation can only be null here
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why we need the InitialBucket class here, if all we are interested in subsequently is SearchResponse#getAggregations.
timeline.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: We do need getDocCount() in one case, so the best way seemed to be an implementation of MultiBucketsAggregation.Bucket which combines both getDocCount() and HasAggregations.
replies.author: dennisoelkers

replies.bodyText: OK, got it. Sorry for missing that.
replies.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it be enough to pass queryResult::getAggregations instead of initialResult?
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure we need this class (see comments on ESPivot above).
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText:
If value is null, metricAggregation will also be null, because otherwise value will have been set in the else if clause above.
I think we can log an error in the else if block instead and get rid of this block.
timeline.author: alex-konn

replies.bodyText: I restructured it a bit and made the check for valueCount/metricAggregation == null more explicit.
replies.author: dennisoelkers

timeline.author: alex-konn
alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: Variable is redundant. We can return clientRequestCaptor.getValue(); directly.
timeline.author: alex-konn
alex-konn
alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: I don't think it's worth having a base class for one method (objectMapperProvider is unused). At this point I'd prefer making indicesOf static and throw it into a utility class in org.graylog.storage.elasticsearch.testing
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think we should use a base class for a few utility methods. They could become static methods in a utility class instead.
They only one that is extensively used is map anyway. list is used once in each subclass, and set is completely unused.
timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.author: alex-konn

timeline.message: Removing method which is deprecated since 3.2.
Provide initial implementation of views code for ES7.
Properly include search source in request.
Use correct types to differentiate between buckets and aggregations for ES7 pivot.
Using `fixedInterval` instead of deprecated `dateHistogramInterval`.
Adding/fixing tests for ES7 views.
Adjusting tests to mocking our client wrapper.
Fixing handling of all messages time range for effective time range.
Adjusting exception format.
Removing unused fixtures, making assertions more robust.
Removing unadaptable test.
Removing support for multiple query backends based on type.
Adding backwards-compatible constructor.
Adding events index mapping for ES7.
Removing invalid assertion.
Adjust test to `template` -> `index_patterns` change for index mapping templates.
Simplifying condition in index mapping factory.
Fixing extraction of document count from initial search result.
A couple of cleanups.
Some more cleanups.
Getting rid of base class.
Adapting to changes from ES 7.8.0
Adapting to changes from ES 7.8.0
Adapting to changes from ES 7.8.0
Always return exact number of hits.
Fixing accidental change.
